page.title: 13Climate in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: The climate of the area is affected by the altitude (300-490m) which lowers tempuratures and increases rainfall, and snowfall in the winter months. The roads are often blocked with snow any time from November to May, but the Council snowplough usually copes within 24 hours. The growing season is very short and most flowers bloom at least 2 weeks behind the lowland areas. A frost has been recorded in every month of the year at the university Plant Breeding Station, Pantydwr, 1\ miles to the West and strong winds are often a problem in the higher, exposed parts particularly.
